Added Moore College to list of seminaries
I'm not the arbiter, it's called 'consensus', and it's 3 to 1 that calling lunatic fringe 'progressive' is pov propaganda. Youre at 3RR now, if you want an arbiter, get one
rv to original wording until a thorough review of the original and suggested replacement terms are decided. Who made you the arbiter of NPOV?
/* Evangelical politics in the United States */ Just take it completely out if no neutral term can be found
no, I don't think so; it's blatantly pov and consensus is already against it
rv to original wording (progressive) until discussion of term is completed.
rv to "leftist" (which I don't like), and rm discussion of terminology. We need to decide on this- not debate inside the article
/* Evangelical politics in the United States */
RV - progressive is the best description. Leftist and liberal are too far out
rv - 'Progressive' is blatantly pov - it's only the POV of some that going back to Caligula, or evolving in the direction of the worm is "progress"
I refer you to the article on "Political progressivism" to see the difference. Go to talk page please.
/* Evangelical politics in the United States */ how about "liberal"?
rv - 'progressive' is far more pov; 'leftist' is more accurate
Leftist is too strident, the intent was to show the counter to conservative.
